scenarioDescription:
The K2-329 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-329 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 760.72 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-329 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-329 system


K2-329 b

K2-329 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2020-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-329 b is 82.680 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-329 b is 8.676 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-329 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system K2-329, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-329 - System With 1 Exoplanet
